result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:12 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Defendant Joseph Andrew Jacobson in court.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Joseph Andrew Jacobson.  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF86, 22CF135, 22TR532 and 22TR533. Set for motion hearing in case 22CF135. Atty Harrelson states he would like to amend his motion and with new information is not prepared to move forward with motion, as requested. Motion withdrawn however may be refiled. Atty Harrelson is not sure if this is a case he is able to keep.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing on October 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Joseph Andrew Jacobson. Includes 22CF86, 22CF135, 22TR532and 22TR533. OFF RECORD -  22CF135 motion hearing scheduled - other cases to trail. Court confirms address. Motion hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Arraignment on June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF86 (PH), 22CF135 (ARGN), 22TR532 & 22TR533 (PTC):
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Joseph Andrew Jacobson appeared. Case called at 10:03 a.m. Court notes 22CF86 is scheduled for a preliminary hearing. ADA Becker calls Officer Dishno to the Stand. S/T Michael Dishno. Employed with the Baldwin Police Department. Direct by ADA Becker. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. Record will reflect identification. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Redirect by ADA Becker. Witness excused. No further evidence by either party. ADA Becker requesting bind over. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial in 22CF86. ADA Becker requesting matter be scheduled for arraignment. In 22CF135, Atty Harrelson has received a copy of the information. DE understands charges and penalties. Enters a NG plea on all Counts, reserving on jurisdictional objections. Waives speedy trial. Court schedules. Atty Harrelson requesting arraignment be scheduled out past 30 days. Address confirmed. Bond continues. Court adjourned at 10:25 a.m.  Arraignment scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed by Justice Support Services. mw        to tfy
TCH amended bond on this matter to remove UA testing and put SCRAM to be consistant with the bond on 22CF135 at Atty Harrelson's request, no objection from the State. kak

*AMENDED* 

 -   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least 4 times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, C.R. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
Filed by Atty Harrelson. km
